content.description:
Docket is an infrastructure layer for credit businesses in real estate, banking and agriculture sectors in Brazil.

Credit operations in Brazil depend on a set of notarized documents and many bureaucratic processes that can be streamlined with technology and hard-to-build integrations with local notary houses. Docket became the only platform to integrate with most of the notary ecosystem and to develop a seamless end-to-end solution for credit businesses, bringing efficiency and increasing sales for its customers.

The company was founded in 2016 by Pedro Roso, Rodrigo Lopes and Flavio Castaldi, and today serves some of the most relevant credit businesses in Brazil, becoming an essential piece of infrastructure in their digital transformations.

details.label: Graduation:
details.value:
Civil Engineering, University of Sao Paulo
MBA, The Wharton School
MA, Lauder Institute University of Pennsylvania

content.title: Alice Lepique
content.subtitle: Vice President
content.description:
Alice Lepique is a Vice President at ONEVC, focused on investing and supporting ONEVC’s portfolio companies. Prior to joining the firm, Alice spent three years at McKinsey & Co. and, during her MBA, worked at Actis, an Infrastructure Private Equity firm, thus developing a generalist strategy and finance toolkit.
Alice holds a BA in Civil Engineering from the University of São Paulo, an MBA from The Wharton School, and an MA in international studies from the Lauder Institute at the University of Pennsylvania.
She is passionate about technology as a propellant of regional development, as well as supporting businesswomen in Latin America. In her free time, she enjoys traveling and outdoor sports like hiking, biking, and running, as well as cooking and spending time with her family.
